but the Canadians were a part of the Allied forces. That is the point
it was a canadian victory because canadians made the plans, trained for the plans, and carried out the plans
rv. France and Britain originally fought before the Canadians arrived, and all three were part of the allies

/* Results */ Deleted: already in "Vmy Memorial" section
/* Results */ Of dubious relevance. No "significance" demonstrated.
/* Results */ Condensed to remove stuff repeated nearly word for word in the next section.
/* Enduring Legacy */ Deleted. POV and no citation. The first days of the Battle of Arras as a whole were successful, not just Vimy.
/* Enduring Legacy */ Deleted: non-encyclopedic. Repeats previous sentence.
/* Results */ Deleted. Inaccurate and no citation. The 3rd Army made a 4-mile advance and held the ground.
/* Enduring Legacy */ Unnecessary repetition: already in background.
